summary: This bill, S. 2605, aims to improve the recruitment and retention of the Department of Defense's cyber workforce. It amends Title 10 of the United States Code, allowing the Secretary of Defense to establish excepted service positions, provide personnel management authority, and implement an interagency transfer agreement. The bill outlines pay and compensation rules, establishes a Defense Digital Executive Service, and mandates implementation plans, reports to Congress, and a Comptroller General assessment. It focuses on addressing the critical need for qualified personnel in the cyber field to enhance national defense.
